alert.note: Alert for Ionia (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 27 at 9:46PM EST until January 31 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Grand Rapids
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Michigan... Sycamore Creek At Holt affecting Ingham County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Michigan... Grand River at Portland affecting Ionia County. Red Cedar River At East Lansing affecting Ingham County. .Water from both snow melt and rainfall continues to work downstream within the Grand River basin. Ice is also affecting river levels in some locations. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL WEDNESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Grand River at Portland. * WHEN...Until Wednesday evening. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Expect minor flooding in the Village of Lyons and low lying areas adjacent to the river. Two Rivers Park in Portland flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM EST Saturday the stage was 9.9 feet. - Bankfull stage is 11.0 feet. - Recent Activity...Ice remains in the Grand River in the vicinity of Portland. Due to potential fluctuations in ice concentration over short time spans rapid river rises are possible. - Forecast...The river has the potential to rise above flood stage Saturday night and into Sunday to a crest of 12.5 feet early Monday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/grr. The next statement will be issued late Sunday night at midnight EST.
